question: When you come across a new idea or topic, what sparks your curiosity first?

options.text: How the technology or system behind it works
The evidence or research that supports it
The effect it has on people’s health or well-being
How it shapes society or public life

question: If you attend a talk outside your usual interests, what draws you in?

options.text: Practical ideas for leadership or management

question: When you read an article or watch a documentary, what angle interests you most?

options.text: How it is designed or implemented
The facts, data, or explanations behind it
The lessons for running organizations or projects

question: When you encounter a real-world problem, what do you want to understand first?

options.text: The technical solution or system change needed
The impact on health and well-being
The rules, policies, or structures involved

question: If you explore a new field just for interest, what attracts you?
When you hear about a new product or service, what makes you curious?

options.text: How it was engineered or developed
The research or science behind it
Its value and sustainability as a business
Its effect on people’s daily lives or health

question: What helps you stay engaged when learning something new over a long period?

options.text: Applying tools or technologies in practical ways
Reflecting on meaning, culture, or ideas
Seeing clear value or outcomes from the effort

question: When a topic becomes challenging, what keeps you motivated to continue?

options.text: Improving how a system or process works
Knowing it supports health or well-being
Contributing to society or community structures

question: Which kind of activity do you willingly return to again and again?

options.text: Experimenting with new technologies or tools

question: What type of learning feels sustainable rather than exhausting?
When you commit time to a project, what makes the effort worthwhile?

options.text: Improving care, wellness, or quality of life

question: What kind of progress do you enjoy tracking over time?

options.text: Deeper insight through research and data
Better understanding of health and human needs

question: In collaborative efforts, what role keeps you consistently involved?
What type of content do you find yourself revisiting voluntarily?

options.text: Tutorials or discussions on new technologies

question: What makes long-term learning feel personally rewarding?

options.text: Mastering tools that solve real problems
Gaining clarity through research and reasoning

question: Which kind of problem feels most meaningful for you to work on now?

options.text: Improving how technology supports daily life
Understanding causes and patterns through evidence

question: When you choose what to learn next, what influences your decision most?

options.text: Practical usefulness of tools or systems
Curiosity about how the world works scientifically
Personal growth through creative or cultural insight

question: Which type of contribution feels most aligned with who you are today?

options.text: Supporting people’s physical or mental health

question: What kind of learning do you see yourself applying immediately?
When reflecting on your experiences, what stands out as most fulfilling?

options.text: Discovering insights through data or study
Helping others stay healthy or supported

question: Which area do you feel your perspective has matured the most?
What kind of impact do you care most about making now?
When you invest time in learning, what outcome matters most?

options.text: Being able to build or fix things
